Catholic Bookmarks
http://http://ccc.usccb.org/cccradio/CatholicBookmarks
Catholic Bookmarks Interviews with Catholic authors from various genres. Interviews with Catholic authors from various genres and provides the Catholic Book Publishers Association Weekly Top 10 bestsellers. http://www.usccb.org/ccc/cb.shtml en-us Copyright 2008 digitalmedia@usccb.org
Catholic Communication Campaign Catholic Authors from Various Genres
USCCB digitalmedia@usccb.org
No
Catholic, USCCB, Catholicism, Catholic Book Publishers, books, Church, Religion
Program 1001
http://www.usccb.org/ccc/cb.shtml Fr. Murray Bodo http://ccc.usccb.org/cccradio/CatholicBookmarks/CatholicBookmarks_Program1001.mp3 Msgr. Paul Vaghi, author of "The Sacraments We Celebrate: A Catholic Guide to the Seven Mysteries of Faith;" book winners from Chicago, Austin, Stockbridge, GA, Port, Florida and East Point, GA. Cheri Lomonte, author of "Stories from Mary's Touch."
Featured This Week
Msgr. Paul Vaghi, author of "The Sacraments We Celebrate: A Catholic Guide to the Seven Mysteries of Faith;" book winners from Chicago, Austin, Stockbridge, GA, Port, Florida and East Point, GA. Cheri Lomonte, author of "Stories from Mary's Touch."
00:29:21 Podcasts Fri, 25 Dec 2009 10:00:00 EST digitalmedia@usccb.org No

Program 951
http://www.usccb.org/ccc/cb.shtml Fr. Murray Bodo http://ccc.usccb.org/cccradio/CatholicBookmarks/CatholicBookmarks_Program951.mp3 Fr. Michael Najim, discusses his book "Radical Surrender" which is collection of letters to seminarians to help them understand the nature of priesthood and the call to holiness. Author Jim Lefebvre ("Loyal Sons") discusses his book about the legendary "four horsemen" of Notre Dame’s 1924 championship football team.
Featured This Week
Fr. Michael Najim, discusses his book "Radical Surrender" which is collection of letters to seminarians to help them understand the nature of priesthood and the call to holiness. Author Jim Lefebvre ("Loyal Sons") discusses his book about the legendary "four horsemen" of Notre Dame’s 1924 championship football team.
00:29:21 Podcasts Fri, 11 Dec 2009 10:00:00 EST digitalmedia@usccb.org No
Program 950
http://www.usccb.org/ccc/cb.shtml Fr. Murray Bodo http://ccc.usccb.org/cccradio/CatholicBookmarks/CatholicBookmarks_Program950.mp3 Author and professor of religious studies Edward Sri ("The Dawn of the Messiah") connects the prophesies of the Old Testament to their fulfillment with the birth of the Christ child. Profile of two books on Mary ("Mary and the Christian Life" and "Maria: Pope Benedict XVI and the Mother of God"). Interview with Donna Steichen, editor of “Chosen,” a book that profiles 23 men and women who were 'chosen' by God to enter His Church.
Featured This Week
Author and professor of religious studies Edward Sri ("The Dawn of the Messiah") connects the prophesies of the Old Testament to their fulfillment with the birth of the Christ child. Profile of two books on Mary ("Mary and the Christian Life" and "Maria: Pope Benedict XVI and the Mother of God"). Interview with Donna Steichen, editor of “Chosen,” a book that profiles 23 men and women who were 'chosen' by God to enter His Church.

Program 949
http://www.usccb.org/ccc/cb.shtml Fr. Murray Bodo http://ccc.usccb.org/cccradio/CatholicBookmarks/CatholicBookmarks_Program949.mp3 Author of "The Saint and the Sultan" Paul Moses discusses his book that delves into St. Francis' dangerous trip to meet with a Muslim leader during the Fifth Crusade and author Fr. Gary Caster discusses his book "Mary: In her Own Words," about the four instances in the Gospels where we hear Mary speak.
Featured This Week
Author of "The Saint and the Sultan" Paul Moses discusses his book that delves into St. Francis' dangerous trip to meet with a Muslim leader during the Fifth Crusade and author Fr.
